dc:description:
MYLK3 was evaluated for autosomal dominant dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) using SOP v10 on 26/06/2025. 

Human genetic evidence supporting this gene-disease relation includes case-level data and segregation data. At least three variants, all proven loss of function (haploinsufficiency), have been reported in humans with DCM, and two were shown to segregate with DCM in affected family members (Tobita et al 2017 PMID: 29235529, Hodatsu et al 2019 PMID: 30690923). There is also evidence of recessive DCM caused by bi-allelic loss-of-function and missense variants, although this evidence was not scored (Al-Hassnan et al 2020 PMID: 32870709 ).

This gene-disease relationship is also supported by experimental evidence, including expression data and animal models. MYLK3 is exclusively expressed in the mammalian heart (Seguchi et al 2007 PMID: 17885681, Chan et al 2008 PMID: 18202317), where its major function is to phosphorylate MCL2 (encoded by MYL2) (Seguchi et al 2007 PMID: 17885681). MYLK3 has been shown to be essential for normal sarcomere assembly (Chan et al 2008 PMID: 18202317, Seguchi et al 2007 PMID: 17885681).

There are multiple animal models including heterozygous knock-out mice and zebrafish and transgenic mouse models for MYLK3 loss-of-function variants previously reported in affected individuals. Zebrafish knock-down studies showed DCM-like phenotypes, with abnormal histology, enlarged cardiac dimensions and thinned ventricular walls in knock-downs vs wild-type (Seguchi et al 2007 PMID: 17885681). Heterozygous knock-out mice showed significant reduction in contractility and increase in left ventricular chamber dimensions both at systole and diastole in vs wild-type. Hemodynamic measurements also showed decrease in end-systolic pressure, LV dilatation and decrease in LV contractility (Tougas et al 2019 PMID: 31244672). A mouse knock-in model of a human splice variant (confirmed to cause haploinsufficiency) showed obvious LV dilatation with reduced LV contraction in homozygous mice, and LV dilatation with mildly reduced LV contraction in heterozygote mice vs wild-type (Hitsumoto et al 2023 PMID: 37128901).
While more evidence is needed to establish this relationship definitively, no convincing contradictory evidence has emerged. This classification was approved by the ClinGen Dilated Cardiomyopathy Working Group on 07/11/2025 (SOP Version 10).

evidence.dc:description: Increased LV chamber dimensions in diastole and decrease hemodynamic measures such as systolic function are observed in DCM. Data in this paper partly represents phenotype of DCM observed in humans, but is milder.
evidence.rdfs:label: Heterozygous MYLK3 Knockout in Mice

evidence.dc:description: This model organism score was reduced as this was a total knockout approach and it is not a clear DCM recapitulation.

Through this KO zebrafish model, investigation at 33hpf of control and mock-injected embryos revealed heart region was ‘swollen’. At 48hpf, ventral dilatation in 45+/-6% z-cMKaugMO embryos was observed. In imaging of cardiac motion, cardiac dimensions significantly larger that controls, with no significant difference in contractility. Histopathology showed pericardial edema, and ventricular walls thinner that control. tEM showed a few poorly differentiated sarcomeres in ventricles of z-cMKaugMO.
evidence.rdfs:label: In Vivo Knockdown of cMLCK

evidence.dc:description: DCM phenotype is defined by LV dilation and systolic dysfunction. This knock-in model of this loss of function variant recapitulates a DCM phenotype in KI-mouse model.
evidence.rdfs:label: Knock-in CRISPR Mediated Model

Abnormalities in sarcomere assembly, regulation, organization, and function has been well described in pathogenesis of genetic cardiomyopathies such as DCM.

evidence.dc:description: MYL2 currently only has limited evidence associating this gene with idiopathic DCM.

In vitro kinase reaction showed a distinct 20 kDa band labelled with 32P only in presence of recombinant cardiac MLCK. The band purified and analyzed using laser desorption/mass spectroscopy and peptide mass fingerprinting showed amino acid sequence homologous to MLC2. Further analysis of this phosphorylation event in vitro revealed endogenous MLC2v, purified from murine heart homogenates, was phosphorylated by recombinant cardiac-MLCK in a Ca2+-calmodulin–dependent manner.
evidence.rdfs:label: Protein interaction with MYL2

evidence.dc:description: Western blot using anti–cardiac MLCK antibody against –cardiac MLCK (cMLCK) detected cMLCK in lysates from neonatal mouse ventricles and atria. Coimmunostaining of cardiac MLCK, actin (phalloidin), and MLC2v. Endogenous cardiac MLCK protein is localized diffusely in the cytoplasm
evidence.rdfs:label: Western Blot in Neonatal Mice

evidence.dc:description: Not scored to avoid double scoring of similar expression data in PMID: 18202317

Expression analysis of MLCK family members using multiple human tissue Northern blot membranes was completed with heart tissue from failing human myocardia. Results revealed MYLK3 (cardiac MLCK) was only expressed in the heart.
evidence.rdfs:label: Northern Blot in Failing Myocardial Heart Tissue

evidence.dc:description: Functional evidence is consistent with expected impact of null variant.

Western blot shows reduced protein expression of mutant MYLK3 versus wild-type MYLK3 in HEK293T cell system (4.3%+/-1.7% ). Cycloheximide chase experiment showed mutant protein more rapidly degraded versus wild-type.
Functional data is consistent with a null variant.
This variant was shown to cause exon-skipping and premature truncation by RNA studies. Kinase activity assay showed variant caused complete lack of kinase activity.
Proven null variant per functional data, scored at default 1.5 pts.

Western blot showed reduced protein expression of mutant MYLK3 versus wild-type in HEK293T cell system (28%+/-7.8% of wild-type). Cycloheximide chase experiment showed mutant protein more rapidly degraded versus wild-type and  MYL2 phosphorylation level shown to be significantly reduced by mutant versus wild-type. Reduced expression also seen by IHC in heart tissue (compared to hearts on non-DCM patient, and DCM patients with RBM20 and BAG3 pathogenic variants).
